cyclone.name: ANA
cyclone.current_location: about 160 miles SSE of Myrtle Beach, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Drifting north-northwest, expected to turn northwest and approach the South Carolina coast, then move slowly up the Mid-Atlantic coast.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: South Carolina coast (near or just north of Charleston–Myrtle Beach area)

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach SC to Cape Lookout NC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern U.S. coastline from northern Georgia through North Carolina, highest impact over South Carolina/North Carolina coasts
weather_observation.wind: Little to no risk of tropical-storm-force winds (≤3% chance). Breezy onshore flow at most.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for the port; primary surge threat is well north along SC/NC coasts.
weather_observation.rainfall: No significant rainfall associated with ANA is expected at Palm Beach (main rainfall over Carolinas).
weather_observation.other_hazards: Increased surf and rip-current risk along the southeast Florida coast.
